main.title: Kendrys homers in 7th straight
main.text:
With home runs in seven consecutive games, Kendrys Morales is one shy of tying the MLB record.

main.title: Carlos Gomez loves cooking, relaxing and watching Francisco Lindor play baseball

Puig nabs Margot at third
main.text: Manuel Margot tries to advance on Yasiel Puig's bobble in right field, but Puig recovers and unleashes a strong throw to nab Margot at third

main.title: The sons of former Rangers teammates Rusty Greer and Bobby Witt have excelled in the States Play Tournament
main.text: The apple didn't fall far from the tree.

main.title: Carpenter's 4-double, 2-RBI game
main.text: Matt "Carp" Carpenter goes 4-for-5 with a pair of RBIs, tying a Major League record with four doubles, including two in the 1st inning

main.title: Carlos Gomez surprised a young Rays fan with both a bat and a hug
main.text: A true ambassador for the game.

main.title: Must C: Kipnis legs out 100th HR
main.text: Jason Kipnis notches his 100th career roundtripper in thrilling fashion, legging out a stand-up inside-the-park homer in Kansas City

main.title: Ji-Man Choi showed off his dance moves for his teammates at first base after an RBI single
Statcast: Schwarber's 444-ft. HR
main.text: Statcast measures the exit velocity, launch angle and projected distance on Kyle Schwarber's 444-foot two-run smash against the Reds

main.title: Goldschmidt's 3-run 432-ft. HR
main.text: Paul "Goldy" Goldschmidt makes it 5-1 D-backs in the bottom of the 3rd with a 432-foot three-run home run to left, his 30th of the year

main.title: These are the top 50 new Players' Weekend nicknames
Bullpen of the Week: Rays
main.text: The Tampa Bay bullpen was honored as the MLB Bullpen of the Week presented by The Hartford for the third straight week.

main.title: On this date: Kent's historic home run
main.text: 8/27/05: Jeff Kent crushes his 300th homer as a second baseman, the 325th home run in total of his career
